Sub: Dealinq with cases of Hoax call / Bomb Threat Call at airports: Regarding
Reference is made to the 13ih Meeting on Strengthening of Aviation Security - Enhanced
Monitoring Mechanism (Level-1 Coordination Meeting) held on 25th July 2023 wherein it has been
directed to implement BCAS AvSec Order No.-06i2016 dated 02.11 .2016 meticulously on ground.
2. 
BCAS AvSec Order No-06/2016 dated 02.11.2016 clearly states that State Police / CISF
shall ensure to provide all the details of the bomb threat calls/hoax calls received at airports and
legal action taken against the hoax callers to the concerned Airport Director/ln-Charge Airport
Management who shall ensure to establish and maintain data base of such bomb threat calls airport
wise.
3. 
ln this regard, I have been directed to request you to take following measures to follow BCAS
guidelines on ground: -
i) To maintain data base on bomb threats calls/ hoax calls and legal action taken thereon.
ii) To provide all factual data pertaining to Hoax Call / Bomb Threat Call to the concerned Airport
Director/ln-Charge Airport Management timely.
iii) Appropriate legal action should be taken in every Hoax Call / Bomb Threat Call and also an
FIR should be lodged with the Local Police.
iv) The Airport Operator and the concerned airlines should also be assisted to lodge police case
in every Hoax Call / Bomb Threat Call.
4. 
CISF being the premier security agency at the airport, the personnel of the ASG should have
a sound knowledge of legal action for any crime/offence at the airports so that the ASG may ensue
that the local police take appropriate legal action as per relevant sections of the law.
5. 
ln this regard, all Zonal DlsG/AP (NZ, SZ, WZ and E&NE) and D|SG/CASO of Delhi, Mumbai,
Bangalore, Hyderabad, Kolkata and Chennai are requested to ensure implementation of the above
directions by the ASGs under their jurisdiction positively
6. 
lG/APS-l & ll are also requested to accord importance to this aspect during their visit at the
airports under their respective jurisdiction.
5. 
This is issued with the approval of the Competent Authority.
